div.div: Ἴ̄δη : Ida, a mountain range, rich in springs, ravines, forest, and game, extending from Phrygia, through Mysia, toward the Hellespont, and subsiding into the plain near Troy, Il. 2.821, Il. 11.183; its summit, Γάργαρον.—Ἴ̄δηθεν, from Ida.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
